titleInfo.title: Ben Glass with H. Leivick, Yiddish Poet

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 5 x 7.5 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: On front of matting: ''Cavarra Studio, Denver'' and handwritten Yiddish words and ''1933.'' Handwritten on back of photograph: ''Ben Glass with H. Leivick, Yiddish poet, 1933. Patients of JCRS. Donor: Mr. and Mrs. Ben Glass.

mods.abstract: Portrait of Ben Glass (at left) and H. Leivick (the pen name of Leyṿiḳ Halpern or Leivick Halper), Yiddish poet. Both men were patients at the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS). Ben Glass was a printer at the JCRS bindery from 1928 to 1978 when it closed. The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish working men along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. It was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside of Denver. This is a copy of the original photograph and matting.
mods.note: Photograph dimensions include matting shown in photograph.
Donated by Ben and Bessie Glass.
